Illuminated Edge

Sosolimited was tasked with creating an inspiring lobby experience for Akamai's new headquarters in Boston. Our team came up with Illuminated Edge: an innovative installation that uses data to impress visitors.

Upon entering the room, visitors were met with a series of touch screens stations and an interactive light sculpture that gives an overview to Akamai's global operation. The animation projected on the sculpture is driven by real data from Akamai's servers. On the other hand, the interactive touch screen application lets visitors further explore different data sets. Check out more on the Sosolimited website.

Technical overview

My first task was to create an app that analyzes Akamai server data throughout the day. With a separate application we could make sure that the data was correct and start imagining how the LED sculpture would react to it.

Traffic and attack data plooted on a map

Once we understood the data format we started working on the final OpenFrameworks app. We experimented with different effects and having the ability to edit then on the fly was super important since we would only see the final LED structure at the very end of the project. Each scene was updated in parallel and then composited together into a framebuffer that you see at the upper left of the video bellow.

Pendant animation showing on the OFW preview app

Another interesting experiment to the project was to add a Lua scripting API to the c++ app. With that functionality we could easily test different effects and if the pendants were mapped in the correct order without the need to re-compile the app every time.
